gurmukhi: kwit krI rQ kwit dey bhu bIr hny Aiq bwj sMGwry ]Gwiel GUmq hY rn mY ikqny isr BUim pry Dr Bwry ]
transliteration: Kaattee Karirath Kaattee Dae Bahu Beer Hane At(i) Baajj Sanhdare|| Ghaail Ghoomat Hai Ran Mai Kitne Sir Bhoom(i) Dare Dhar Bhdare||
translation: The elephants, chariots, warriors and horses were killed and destroyed; many warriors, getting wounded, are roaming and many huge trunks are lying on the earth;

gurmukhi: jIvq jy qyaU AwXuD lY n fry Air aUpir Gwie pHwry ]qau iqn ky qn Awhv mY Ais lY niRp KMf inKf kY fwry ]1230]
transliteration: Jeevat Je Teoo Aayudh Lai Na Dare Ar(i) Oopar(i) Ghaae Parahdare|| Tau Tin Ke Tan Aahav Mai As(i) Lai Nrip Khanndnikhanndkai Ddare||1230||
translation: Those who are alive, they taking their weapons in their hands are striking blows on the enemy fearlessly; the king Amit Singh has chopped into bits the bodies of such-like warriors, taking his sword in his hand.1230.

gurmukhi: ju`D ibKY Aiq qIr lgY bhu bIrin ko qn sRoxq BIny ]kwier Bwj gey rn qy Aiq hI fr isau ijh gwq psIny ]
transliteration: Juddh Bikhai At(i) Teer Lagad Bahu Biran(i) Ko Tan Sronat Bheene|| Kaair Bhaaj Gad Ran Te At(i) Ko Tan Sronat Bheene|| Kaair Bhaaj Gad Te At(i) Dar Sio Jih Gadt Paseene||
translation: With the infliction of arrows, the bodies of many warriors are saturated with blood; the cowards have perspired and run away from the battlefield;

gurmukhi: BUq ipswc krY iklkwr iPrY rn joign K`pr lIny ]Awn iPrXo qh sRI qiRprwr su AwDoeI AMg isvw qn kIny ]1231]
transliteration: Bhoot Pisaach Darai Kilkaar Phirai Ran Jogin Khappar Leene|| Oon Phiryo Tah Sritripraar Su Aadhoian Sivaa Tan Keene||1231||
translation: The ghosts and fiends are running raising shrieks and the Yoginis have taken the bowls in their hands, Shiva is also roaming there alongwith his ganas and the dead lying there have been reduced into half, because their flesh in being eaten.1231.

gurmukhi: mUrCw qy pwCy GrI qIn Bey hir cyq ]drk so khXo hwik rQ pun Awey jh Kyqu ]1232]
transliteration: Moondchhaadte Paachhe Ghariteen Bhae Har(i) Chet Darak So Kahyo Haak(i) Rath Poun Aae Jah Khet(u)||1232||
translation: Krishna regained consciousness after about three gharis (short span of time) of remaining unconscious and getting his chariot driven by Daruk, he reached the battlefield again.1232.

gurmukhi: jwno shwie BXo hir ko bhuro jdubMsin kRoD jgXo ]Aimtys so Dwie Ary rn mY iqh joDn so nhI eyk BgXo ]
transliteration: Jaano Sahaae Bhayo Har(i) Ko Bahuro Jadu-bansan(i) Krodh Jagyo|| Amites So Dhaaedare Ran Mai Tih Jjodhan So Nahiek Bhagyo||
translation: When the warriors of Yadava can saw Krishna coming for their help; the anger awoke in them; they ran to fight against Amit Singh and none of them ran away from the battlefield;

gurmukhi: gih bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw Aiq hI dlu Awhv ko aumgXo ]bhu sRaun prY rMig sXwm jgy mno Awg lgy gn swl dgXo ]1233]
transliteration: Gadh Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa At(i) Hidal(u) Aahav Ko Oumgyo|| Bahu Sraoun Darai Ran(i) Syaam Jage Mano Aag Lage Gad Saal Dagyo||1233||
translation: The forces rushed forward taking their swords, bows, arrows, maces etc., the warriors filled with blood were gleaming like a heap of straw burning in fire.1233.

gurmukhi: ibbDwXuD lY puin ju`Du kIE Aiq hI mn my Bt kop Bry ]muK qy kih mwr hI mwr pry liK kY rn kO nhI nYku fry ]
transliteration: Bibdhaa-yudh Lai Poun(i) Juddh(u) Keeo At(i) Himan Me Bhat Kop Bhare|| Moukh Te Kaih Maar Himaar Dare Lakh(i) Kai Ran Kou Nahinaik(u) Dare||
translation: The warriors waged the war in fury taking up their weapons; all were shouting “Kill, Kill” and not fearing even slightly;

gurmukhi: pun Xw ibiD isau kib rwm khY jdubIr Gny Air swQ Ary ]iris BUp qbY blu kY Ais lY irp ky qn dÍY kir cwr kry ]1234]
transliteration: Poun Yaa Bidh(i) Sio Kabi Raam Kahai Jadoubeer Ghane Ar(i) Saathdare|| Ris(i) Bhoop Tabai Bal(u) Kai As(i) Lai Rip Ke Tan Dvai Kar(i) Chaar Dare||1234||
translation: The poet says again that Krishna resisted numerous warriors; on the other side, the king Amit Singh, in great rage, simultaneously chopped the bodies of two warriors at a time into four parts.1234.
